meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by a stereotype.
meanings.sent1: The movie portrayed a stereotypic image of the villain.
meanings.sent2: Her behavior was very stereotypic of a typical teenager.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing how his outfit was so stereotypic of a detective.
meanings.sent4: The town's architecture had a stereotypic charm that drew in tourists.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the stereotypic beauty of the countryside.

meanings.definition: Conforming to a fixed or general pattern.
meanings.sent1: The factory produced stereotypic products for mass consumption.
meanings.sent2: His speech followed a stereotypic structure often seen in debates.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing how his daily routine was so stereotypic of a robot.
meanings.sent4: Her handwriting had a stereotypic neatness that stood out.
meanings.sent5: The song's melody had a stereotypic rhythm that was catchy.
